description.narrative:
the project " empowering migrant workers" is implimented by the Center for Development and Integration (CDI). The project will be implemented in Dong Nai province, Hai Phong city and Ha Noi with involvement of Dong Nai Legal Aid center of trade union and Mnet - network of action for migrant workers.
goal: # Measurable improvements in wages, working conditions and equitable social protectionfor migrant workers in urban and peri-urban areas in Vietnam; # Changes in policies by ASEAN and other regional organizations on gender impact, safe migration, and informal workers# access to and financing of social protection
Long term outcome: At least 2 improved policies on working conditions and basic social services result from advocacy and public mobilization by migrant workers and theM.net coalition
Medium outcome: 1. Increased capacity of organised migrant workers and CSOs to influence employers# policies for internal migrant workers through improved working conditions, fair wages and reduced short term contracts; indicators: # No of Workers groups are assessed that have improved their organization and influencing capacity # No of Workers groups# and their networks# initiatives/movement taken to claim for their rights
2. Multi Stakeholder Platform (MSP) functions in facilitating discussions and negotiations among key stakeholders, including representatives of worker organizations, Trade Union, employers, and local government; indicators: # Number of proposals / recommendations from the workers# groups to improve practice regarding social protection that arethe topic of discussion by the local authorities, employers and local service providers. # No of MSP meetings/ dialogues
3. Increased public pressure towards the government to improve working conditions and basic social services indicators: # Number of proposals/ recommendations from the workers# organisations to improve practice regarding social protection that are the topic of discussion by the local authorities, employers andlocal service providers. # no of people/activist participated in the campaign # no of media citations of Oxfam and partners# work/research
4. Organised migrant workers and CSOs benefit from new linkages with regional networks to jointly monitor social protection and safe migration through common research, analysis, and evidence indicators: # No of discussions among workers groups and CSOs that are inputs for regional monitoring on social protection. # A learning mechanism establishedto facilitatelearning and sharing cross the region # Number of lessons learnt that are applied in Vietnam as benefits of regional networking
short term outcomes: 1. Internal migrant workers (particularly women) will be more organised and networked to take collective actions to claim for their rights indicators: # No. of Workers groups and their networks of migrant workers are formed # Numberof workers groups of which the leaders take initiative to promote gender equality amongst the members of the self-helpgroups. # Number of women participate in groups/networks
2. Increased capacity of organised migrant workers and CSOs to influence local government policies and practices on social protection indicators: # Number of local groups that have set up an advocacy effort at local level # Number of workers leaders joint Mnet advocacy effort at national level
3. CSO working groups have adequate capacity in generating evidence and facilitating MSP discussions indicators: # Increased number of members ofM.net and CSOs engaging in M.net#s advocacy activities as allies. # Number of proposals for policy and practice changes at national level that partners have identified and agreed for potential joint advocacy # Average score of Mnet capacity index # Average score of Mnet effectiveness index
4. Specific recommendations/ proposals/ models from the workers groups especially migrant workers and from the labour right working groups sent to relevant parties have received positive feedbacks; indicators: # Number of evidence-based recommendations produced by Mnet and MSP Number of public dialoges and debates organised by Mnet and MSP # Number of stakeholders (categorised by types of stakeholders) participates in dialogs and debates
5. Labour issues from Vietnam have been discussed in the regional and international forums; theproject' lessons and models have been shared in those forums indicators: # number of learnings discussed in workers groups and partner organizations # Number of workers participate in learning and sharing events organised by worker representativess/partner organisations

participating-org.narrative: Center for Development and Integration (CDI) is Vietnamese non #governmental, non- profit organization working for the rights of the disadvantaged groups to build a society of equity, solidarity and sustainable development. Vision The Center for Development and Integration aims at socio-economic development and good governance to build a society where the poor, women, men and children are respected and treated fairly in the context of rapid economic integration in Vietnam and Asia. Mission To make acontribution to narrowing the social gaps and finding solutions to the emerging issues of the society through supporting activities, advocacy and capacitybuilding. Goal (2015-2020) To be a capable and prestigious civil society organizaton that aims towards equitable and sustainable development and shared prosperity through activities to promote and ensure the rights of disadvantaged groups. Priorities themes Good Governance Labor rights Inclusive Growth Regarding Good Governance theme, CDI bringsmore than 8 years of experience working in participatory planning and budget transparency, accountability and people#s participation (BTAP) in Vietnam. CDI is responsible for carrying out the Open Budget Survey in Vietnam every two years and working on monthly online budget tracker for Vietnam. Joining the international network on budget transparency given CDI the many chances to exchange, shared learning and capacity building on budget transparency and accountability, especially citizen budget tool. CDIis a member of Budget Transparency Coalition of Vietnam CSOs advocating for State budget law amendment towards Transparency, Accountability and People Participation; an active member of CSO#s workinggroup advocating Vietnam Government joining Open Government Partnership. CDI also has significant local experiences across provinces in Vietnam, having carried out social audits, budget monitoring, participatory budget and planning, promoting people participationin development process, capacity building forlocal partners and developed working relationships with local institutions and actors. CDI has been collaborating with Irish Aid, EC, Oxfam, AFAP, CBPP (Center on Budget and Policy Priorities), etc for the work on BTAPin Vietnam.
